messages.title: Citizen backs Lib Dem Mike Pringle
messages.content: If the Citizen had a vote in the Scottish Parliament Election on 5th May it would cast it enthusiastically for Mike Pringle.

messages.title: Mike Pringle Says
messages.content: New Labour's New Deals: Council Tax Up, Services Down!

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campaigned with parents and teachers to secure funding for redevelopment of James Gillespie's and Boroughmuir High Schools. Voted to end the graduate endowment and with students as they opposed tuition fees. Now fighting to secure land from NHS Lothian for Sciennes Primary.
Led the campaigns to save eleven post offices across South Edinburgh. Warrender

issues.education: Campaigned with parents and teachers to secure funding for redevelopment of James Gillespie's and Boroughmuir High Schools. Voted to end the graduate endowment and with students as they opposed tuition fees.
issues.health: Now fighting to secure land from NHS Lothian for Sciennes Primary.

leaflet.personalStatement: Mike Pringle has lived locally for more than 40 years and has been campaigning for our area for more than 20 of them.

politicalExperience.achievements: Mike first became editor of The Citizen in 1982.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The content of this leaflet indicates a focus on local issues such as education and business within the community, as well as the candidate's long-term involvement in local affairs.
